data.enText: catch
to catch a person or an animal and keep them as a prisoner or in a confined space

data.chText: 盟军俘虏了300多名敌方士兵。
data.enText: Allied troops captured over 300 enemy soldiers.

data.chText: 那些动物用网捕获后被卖到当地的动物园。
data.enText: The animals are captured in nets and sold to local zoos.
take control
to take control of a place, building, etc. using force
The city was captured in 1941.
to succeed in getting control of sth that other people are also trying to control

data.chText: 这家公司已争取到九成的市场份额。
data.enText: The company has captured 90% of the market.
make sb interested
to make sb interested in sth

data.chText: 他们用木偶来启发小观众的想象力。
data.enText: They use puppets to capture the imagination of younger audiences.
feeling/atmosphere

data.chText: （用图画、文章、电影等准确地）表达，刻画，描述
data.enText: to succeed in accurately expressing a feeling, an atmosphere, etc. in a picture, piece of writing, film/movie, etc.

data.chText: 这篇文章把国民的情绪把得很准。
data.enText: The article captured the mood of the nation.
film/record/paint
to film/record/paint, etc. sb/sth

data.chText: 袭击事件已被保安摄像机拍摄下来。
data.enText: The attack was captured on film by security cameras.
sb's heart
to make sb love you
computing
to put sth into a computer in a form it can use
the act of capturing sb/sth or of being captured
the capture of enemy territory
He evaded capture for three days.
data capture

simple_means.memory_skill: capt 抓 + ure 表行为 → 抓住 → 逮捕

ex.enText: He was arrested by the police.
His friend was arrested for fraud.

synonyms.bx: 指对罪犯或犯罪嫌疑人进行拘捕并予以监禁或拘留。

ex.enText: He was captured in a battle.

ex.chText: 那只老虎终于被捕获了。

synonyms.bx: 指通过使用武力或计谋等捉住人或动物并将其关押。
普通用词，多指通过追踪、武力、突袭等捉住跑动或隐藏中的人或动物。

ex.chText: 那个小女孩突然抓住他的胳膊。
ex.enText: Suddenly the little girl seized his arm.

ex.chText: 谁抓住了受惊的马的缰绳？
ex.enText: Who seized the reins of the spooked horse?

tr: the act of forcibly dispossessing an owner of property
the removal of an opponent's piece from the chess board
the act of taking of a person by force
any process in which an atomic or nuclear system acquires an additional particle
a process whereby a star or planet holds an object in its gravitational field
succeed in catching or seizing, especially after a chase
capture as if by hunting, snaring, or trapping
example: I caught a rabbit in the trap today

tr: succeed in representing or expressing something intangible

example: She captured all the men's hearts

tr: take possession of by force, as after an invasion
example: the invaders seized the land and property of the inhabitants

tr: bring about the capture of an elementary particle or celestial body and causing it enter a new orbit
example: This nucleus has captured the slow-moving neutrons

value.def: If you capture someone or something, you catch them, especially in a war.

example.ex: The guerrillas shot down one aeroplane and captured the pilot...
example.tran: 游击队击落了一架飞机,并俘获了飞行员。

example.ex: The whole town celebrated when two tanks were captured...
example.tran: 全城居民庆祝缴获了两辆坦克。

example.ex: King Arthur himself captures the beast and cuts off its head...
example.tran: 亚瑟王亲自捉住怪物,并砍下它的头。

example.ex: Israel captured the territory in the 1967 War.
example.tran: 在1967年的战争中,以色列占领了这块领土。

example.ex: ...the murders of fifteen thousand captured Polish soldiers.
example.tran: 对15,000名被俘波兰士兵的屠杀

example.ex: ...the final battles which led to the army's capture of the town...
example.tran: 军队攻占该城镇前的最后几场战斗

example.ex: The shooting happened while the man was trying to evade capture by the security forces.
example.tran: 那个男子试图逃脱安全部队的抓捕时,有人开了枪。

value.tran: (尤指在战争中)俘虏，擒获，占领，夺取

value.def: If something or someone captures a particular quality, feeling, or atmosphere, they represent or express it successfully.

example.ex: Chef Idris Caldora offers an inspired menu that captures the spirit of the Mediterranean...
example.tran: 厨师伊德里斯·卡尔多拉开出一份富有地中海特色的菜单，让人眼前一亮。

example.ex: Their mood was captured by one who said, 'Students here don't know or care about campus issues.'
example.tran: 一个人的话道出了他们的心情，“这儿的学生既不了解也不关心校园问题。”

value.tran: 代表（特点);表现,体现(感情、气氛)

value.def: If something captures your attention or imagination, you begin to be interested or excited by it. If someone or something captures your heart, you begin to love them or like them very much.

example.ex: ...the great names of the Tory party who usually capture the historian's attention.
example.tran: 往往会引起历史学家关注的保守党大人物

example.ex: ...the issue that has captured the imagination of nearly the whole nation.
example.tran: 激发了几乎所有国人想象力的争论

example.ex: ...one man's undying love for the woman who captured his heart.
example.tran: 一个男人对他心仪的女人矢志不渝的爱

value.tran: 吸引(注意力);激发(想象);赢得(喜爱)

value.def: If an event is captured in a photograph or on film, it is photographed or filmed.

example.ex: The incident was captured on videotape...
The images were captured by TV crews filming outside the base.
example.tran: 这些影像是电视剧组人员在外景地拍摄的。
拍摄到那一不幸场面的摄影师

value.def: If you capture something that you are trying to obtain in competition with other people, you succeed in obtaining it.

example.ex: In 1987, McDonald's captured 19 percent of all fast-food sales...
example.tran: 1987年,麦当劳占据了整个快餐业销售额的19%。

example.ex: The Socialist candidate has captured eighty-five per cent of the vote in the three-way presidential race.
example.tran: 社会党候选人在这场三人角逐的总统竞选中已经获得85%的选票。

trans: 管制俘获；监管俘获；规制俘获；规制俘虏；管制俘虏
截屏软件；屏幕捕获；截屏；屏幕截图；屏幕抓图
图像抓取；图像捕捉；使用程序；影像撷取；图像采集
撷取触发器；捕获触发器
批量采集；批采集；批次抓取功能；批次撷取；批量捕捉
视频捕获；视频捕捉；影像撷取；视频采集；视讯撷取
数据采集(尤指利用计算机)
动作捕获；动作捕捉；运动捕捉；动态捕捉；动作捕捉技术

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to take, to hold, to seize 拿, 抓, 握住
rootsaffixes.title: cap(t), cep(t), ceive, cip, cup

partsOfSpeech.dec: ac 加强 + cept 拿，抓，握住 → 一再拿 → 接受
accept 接受 + ability 可…性 → 可接受性
anti〔= ante 前面〕+ cip 拿，抓，握住 + ate 做，造成，使… → 提前把握〔事物发展结果〕→ 预料
cap 拿，抓，握住 + acious 多…的 →〔有地方〕可多拿的 → 宽阔的
cap 拿，抓，握住 + acity 性质，状态，情况 → 抓住〔事物〕的能力 → 才能
capt 拿，抓，握住 + ain 表人 → 掌握一群人 → 首领
cap 拿，抓，握住 + tion 表名词 → 抓住〔文章的大意〕→ 标题
capt 拿，抓，握住 + ious …的 → 抓人〔毛病〕的 → 吹毛求疵的
captiv〔e〕俘虏 + ate 使… → 使…变成俘虏 → 迷惑
capt 拿，抓，握住 + ive 表人 → 抓住〔的人〕→ 俘虏
capt 拿，抓，握住 + ure 表行为 → 抓住 → 逮捕
con 共同 + ceive 拿，抓，握住 → 大家一起抓〔思想〕→ 想像；构想
con 共同 + cept 拿，抓，握住 + ion 表名词 → 共同把握住的〔思想〕→ 观念
de 否定，非 + ceive 拿，抓，握住 → 不拿来 → 欺骗
de 否定，非 + cept 拿，抓，握住 + ive …的 → 不拿来 → 欺骗性的
e 出 + man 手 + cip 拿，抓，握住 + ate 做，造成，使… → 把被抓的手放出来 → 解放
ex 出 + cept 拿，抓，握住 → 拿出去 → 把…除外
in 进入 + cept 拿，抓，握住 + ion 表名词 →〔开始〕进来拿 → 开端
in 进入 + cip 拿，抓，握住 + ient …的 → 开始的，初期的
inter 在…之间 + cept 拿，抓，握住 → 在〔路程间〕抓人）→ 拦截
oc 加强 + cup 拿，抓，握住 + ant 人 → 一再拿的人 → 占有者
oc 加强 + cup 拿，抓，握住 + ation 行为，过程，状态，结果 → 职业；占有
oc 加强 + cup 拿，抓，握住 + y 表行为 → 占领；使用
per 贯穿 + ceive 拿，抓，握住 → 全部抓住 → 发觉
pre 预先 + cept 拿，抓，握住 → 预先掌握的〔话〕→ 箴言
pre 预先 + occupation 职业；占有 → 首先占有〔注意力〕→ 全神贯注
re 一再 + ceive 拿，抓，握住 → 一再拿到 → 收到
re 一再 + cept 拿，抓，握住 + acle 表物 → 装了可以再装的物品 → 容器
sus 下 + cept 拿，抓，握住 + ible …的 → 容易被〔病〕抓住的 → 易患病的
